verses.kjv: Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob.
verses.web: Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt (every man and his household came with Jacob):
verses.ct: These are the names of Israel's sons who came to Egypt with Jacob, each bringing his household:

verses.kjv: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
verses.web: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
verses.ct: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,

verses.kjv: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
verses.web: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
verses.ct: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,

verses.kjv: Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.web: Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
verses.ct: Dan, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

verses.kjv: And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already.
verses.web: All the souls who came out of Jacob’s body were seventy souls, and Joseph was in Egypt already.
verses.ct: In all, 70 of Jacob's descendants went to Egypt. Joseph was already there.

verses.kjv: And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
verses.web: Joseph died, as did all his brothers, and all that generation.
verses.ct: In time, Joseph died, and so did all his brothers and everyone in that generation.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
verses.web: The children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and grew exceedingly mighty; and the land was filled with them.
verses.ct: But the people of Israel had many children and multiplied rapidly. They became so numerous and powerful that the land was full of them.

verses.kjv: Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph.
verses.web: Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who didn’t know Joseph.
verses.ct: Then a new king came to power in Egypt — one who knew nothing about Joseph.

verses.kjv: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we:
verses.web: He said to his people, “Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we.
verses.ct: He told his people, "Look, the Israelites have grown more numerous and more powerful than we are.

verses.kjv: Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land.
verses.web: Come, let’s deal wisely with them, lest they multiply, and it happen that when any war breaks out, they also join themselves to our enemies and fight against us, and escape out of the land.”
verses.ct: We need to deal with them carefully. If they keep growing and a war breaks out, they might side with our enemies, fight against us, and escape from the country."

verses.kjv: Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh treasure cities, Pithom and Raamses.
verses.web: Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their burdens. They built storage cities for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.
verses.ct: So the Egyptians put brutal slave drivers over them to crush them with forced labor. The Israelites built the storage cities of Pithom and Raamses for Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.
verses.web: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and the more they spread out. They started to dread the children of Israel.
verses.ct: But the more the Egyptians oppressed them, the more the Israelites multiplied and spread. This filled the Egyptians with dread.

verses.kjv: And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigour:
verses.web: The Egyptians ruthlessly made the children of Israel serve,
verses.ct: So the Egyptians worked the Israelites ruthlessly.

verses.kjv: And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in morter, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service, wherein they made them serve, was with rigour.
verses.web: and they made their lives bitter with hard service in mortar and in brick, and in all kinds of service in the field, all their service, in which they ruthlessly made them serve.
verses.ct: They made their lives miserable with backbreaking labor — mixing mortar, making bricks, and doing every kind of work in the fields. Every task forced on them was carried out under brutal conditions.

verses.kjv: And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives, of which the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:
verses.web: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah,
verses.ct: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives — one named Shiphrah and the other Puah.

verses.kjv: And he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.
verses.web: and he said, “When you perform the duty of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them on the birth stool, if it is a son, then you shall kill him; but if it is a daughter, then she shall live.”
verses.ct: He told them, "When you help the Hebrew women give birth, watch as the baby is delivered. If it's a boy, kill him. If it's a girl, let her live."

verses.kjv: But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men children alive.
verses.web: But the midwives feared God, and didn’t do what the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the baby boys alive.
verses.ct: But the midwives feared God, so they refused to obey the king of Egypt. They let the baby boys live.

verses.kjv: And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men children alive?
verses.web: The king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said to them, “Why have you done this thing and saved the boys alive?”
verses.ct: The king summoned the midwives and demanded, "Why have you done this? Why are you letting the boys live?"

verses.kjv: And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them.
verses.web: The midwives said to Pharaoh, “Because the Hebrew women aren’t like the Egyptian women; for they are vigorous and give birth before the midwife comes to them.”
verses.ct: The midwives answered Pharaoh, "Hebrew women aren't like Egyptian women. They're so strong and vigorous that they give birth before we even arrive."

verses.kjv: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.
verses.web: God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied, and grew very mighty.
verses.ct: God was good to the midwives for what they did. Meanwhile, the Israelites kept multiplying and growing even stronger.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them houses.
verses.web: Because the midwives feared God, he gave them families.
verses.ct: Because the midwives feared God, he blessed them with families of their own.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.
verses.web: Pharaoh commanded all his people, saying, “You shall cast every son who is born into the river, and every daughter you shall save alive.”
verses.ct: Then Pharaoh issued a command to all his people: "Throw every newborn Hebrew boy into the Nile River, but let every girl live."
